stories.title: 11-year-old discovers ancient turtle fossil on BLM land
stories.summary: An 11-year-old named Touren Pope made an incredible find while rockhounding in Wyoming: a fossilized turtle dating back nearly 48 million years! This remarkable discovery highlights the importance of exploring our public lands and the treasures they hold.

stories.title: Is being virtuous good for you – or just people around you? A study suggests traits like compassion may support your own well-being
stories.summary: New research suggests that practicing virtues like compassion and patience not only benefits those around us but also enhances our own well-being. This study adds to the age-old debate about the connection between virtue and personal happiness.

stories.title: Snowplow driver saves stranded motorist in Indianapolis
stories.summary: In Indianapolis, a snowplow driver came to the rescue of a stranded motorist during a heavy snowfall. Jose Trejo was stuck in his vehicle, but thanks to the quick action of the driver, he was able to get back on the road safely.

stories.title: Teacher shocked as he's presented with £94,000 supercar outside school
stories.summary: A teacher in Eastbourne was left in disbelief after winning a £94,000 supercar just weeks after his previous car was totaled in an accident. This unexpected turn of events has certainly brightened his days!

stories.title: Nelson donates kidney to cousin: ‘Huge gift’
stories.summary: Lacey Nelson made a life-changing decision by donating her kidney to her cousin, Max Amsden, who was in desperate need of a transplant. This act of generosity showcases the deep bonds of family and the power of giving.

stories.title: Blue Spring State Park proves accessibility belongs in nature
stories.summary: A family took their father, a double amputee, on a hike at Blue Spring State Park, proving that accessibility in nature is essential. This outing not only transformed their experience but also highlighted the importance of inclusive outdoor spaces.

stories.title: Otter Tail County appraiser commended for compassionate care during crisis
stories.summary: Todd Finkelson, an appraiser in Otter Tail County, was commended for his compassionate response during a crisis. His quick thinking helped save a life, reminding us of the impact one person can have in a moment of need.

stories.title: World's oldest known rock art predates modern humans' entrance into Europe — and it was found in an Indonesian cave
stories.summary: Scientists have uncovered the world's oldest known rock art, a hand stencil dating back at least 67,800 years in Indonesia. This discovery provides fascinating insights into the early presence of modern humans in the region.

stories.title: Huntington’s Disease Has Local Man Walking/Running Causeway Bridge Daily
stories.summary: Rip Wagner, who battles Huntington’s disease, has taken to walking and running over the Causeway Bridge daily. His commitment to movement and exercise not only helps him manage his condition but also inspires others to stay active.

stories.title: Heroic Central New York Police Officer Getting National Attention
stories.summary: Officer Jamie Pastorello from Syracuse has gained national attention for his kind gesture of offering a ride to a woman struggling with groceries in freezing weather. His simple act of generosity has touched hearts and showcased the best of humanity.

stories.title: AI predicts future disease risk using sleep patterns
stories.summary: Stanford researchers have developed an innovative AI model called SleepFM that predicts future disease risks by analyzing sleep patterns. This groundbreaking technology highlights the significant impact of sleep on overall health, paving the way for better preventive care and health management.

stories.title: Downtown church takes rare step amid cold, opens doors as overnight shelter
stories.summary: In a remarkable act of compassion, St. Paul’s Cathedral in London opened its doors as an overnight shelter for the homeless during extreme cold weather. This historic decision not only provided warmth but also fostered a sense of community and support for those in need.

stories.title: Orlando VA Program Uses Dungeons & Dragons to Support Veteran Wellness
stories.summary: At the Orlando VA Healthcare System, veterans are finding healing and connection through the REVEAL Program, which uses Dungeons & Dragons as a therapeutic tool. This creative approach is transforming lives by fostering camaraderie and emotional wellness among participants.

stories.title: Local students join forces to combat hunger in Georgia and Kentucky
stories.summary: Students from Lanier High School's band and football team have joined forces to combat hunger in Georgia and Kentucky. Partnering with Meals to Missions, they are making a meaningful impact by addressing food insecurity in their communities.

stories.title: This DIY Genius Has Powered His Entire Home With Old Laptop Batteries Since 2016
stories.summary: One innovative homeowner has turned e-waste into a sustainable power source, running his entire home on old laptop batteries since 2016. This DIY project showcases creativity and resilience, proving that discarded technology can be repurposed for a greener future.

stories.title: Why simply saying ‘hello’ makes the world better
stories.summary: In a world dominated by technology, the simple act of greeting others can create a sense of connection and community. A recent article emphasizes how saying 'hello' can brighten someone's day and help restore the warmth of human interaction in our busy lives.

stories.title: This Minnesota Bar Was Built From 300-Year Old Wood
stories.summary: The Trestle Inn in Minnesota is a unique bar built from wood sourced from a 300-year-old abandoned railroad bridge. This blend of history and craftsmanship offers patrons a drink in a setting that tells a story of the past.

stories.title: At 408 mph, this drone has just set a Guinness-certified record and the best part is, it was entirely built in-house using a 3D printer
stories.summary: A father-son duo in South Africa has set a Guinness World Record by creating a 3D-printed drone that reached a speed of 408 mph. This achievement highlights the potential of 3D printing technology in pushing the boundaries of innovation.

stories.title: North Carolina Amazon Driver From Charlotte Donates Entire $10,000 Reward to Local Children’s Hospital After Receiving Record Customer Thanks
stories.summary: A Charlotte Amazon driver, GreyIon Anthony, made headlines after donating his entire $10,000 reward to a local children’s hospital. His selfless act of generosity showcases the power of kindness and community support.

stories.title: The 40-Year Career that Quietly Helped Redefine an Arkansas Gas Utility
stories.summary: Fred Kirkwood’s 40-year career in Arkansas gas utility began as a love story, showcasing how personal connections can shape professional journeys. His dedication to his work and community reflects a life well-lived, blending passion with purpose.

stories.title: Central Oregon innovator nears launch of flying car
stories.summary: After nearly two decades of hard work, Central Oregon innovator Sam Bousfield is on the brink of launching a flying car that can drive on roads and take off from small airports. This groundbreaking project could revolutionize transportation and make the dream of flying cars a reality, blending science fiction with real-world innovation.

stories.title: Uncovering the Extraordinary Life of Joseph Reynolds
stories.summary: As Ireland commemorates its revolutionary past, a researcher has uncovered the remarkable life of Joseph Reynolds, a man who dedicated fifty years to serving multiple causes. His story sheds light on the complexities of history and the individuals who shaped it, reminding us of the power of commitment and resilience.

stories.title: The Artemis 2 Astronauts Will Observe Parts of the Moon Humans Have Never Laid Eyes On
stories.summary: NASA's Artemis 2 mission is set to make history by sending astronauts to observe parts of the Moon that have never been seen by human eyes. This mission marks a significant step towards humanity's return to the lunar surface, paving the way for future exploration and scientific discoveries.

stories.title: Man goes from homelessness to helping
stories.summary: A veteran's journey from homelessness to helping others highlights the power of connection in recovery. Through the VA Peer Support Program, he now shares his experiences to inspire fellow veterans, proving that overcoming obstacles can lead to meaningful change and support for others.

stories.title: Columbia Falls runners complete 24-hour run-a-thon to support injured teammate
stories.summary: Columbia Falls High School cross country teammates rallied together for a 24-hour run-a-thon to support their injured teammate, Hazel Alexander. This incredible display of community spirit not only raises funds for her recovery but also strengthens the bonds of friendship and teamwork.

stories.title: Calf Rescued from Harmony Coast Cliff After Being Missing for Over a Week
stories.summary: A 5-month-old calf was dramatically rescued from a steep coastal cliff after being stranded for over a week. Firefighters worked tirelessly to hoist the calf to safety, showcasing the dedication and bravery of first responders in animal rescue situations.

stories.title: Fall River standout multi-sport athlete has begun the fight of his young life with community support
stories.summary: Wesley Araujo, a standout athlete from Fall River, is now facing the fight of his life against leukemia. With the support of his community, he embodies resilience and determination, proving that even in the toughest times, the spirit of a competitor shines through.

stories.title: Iqaluit students turn science and math into a business
stories.summary: Students at École des Trois-Soleils in Iqaluit are turning their science and math skills into a thriving business by creating custom 3D-printed products. This innovative project not only enhances their learning experience but also fosters entrepreneurship and creativity among young minds.

stories.title: Owners of San Francisco restaurants offer housing to employees
stories.summary: In a heartening move, the owners of Rich Table in San Francisco are providing housing for their employees in the apartments above their new restaurant. This initiative highlights the importance of community support and the commitment to the well-being of their staff.

stories.title: Her ancestors were expelled from Spain. Now she’s bringing bagels to Madrid.
stories.summary: Tamara Cohen is reconnecting with her Sephardic roots by bringing bagels to Madrid, a city that previously lacked this beloved food. Her journey not only fills a culinary gap but also celebrates cultural heritage, creating a unique blend of history and modern dining.

stories.title: From Rescues To Smiles: How Pamela Kramer Glickman Built San Diego’s Beloved Pammy’s Pony Parties Mobile Petting Zoo
stories.summary: Pamela Kramer Glickman's journey began with a rescue of a newborn lamb, leading her to create Pammy's Pony Parties, a beloved mobile petting zoo in San Diego. This initiative not only brings joy to children but also fosters a deep connection between animals and the community, showcasing the power of compassion and creativity.

stories.title: Could a drug slow aging? UW-Madison researchers seek answers in trial
stories.summary: Researchers at UW-Madison are exploring the potential of rapamycin, a drug used in organ transplants, to slow aging in humans. Early evidence suggests it could enhance both the quality and length of life, sparking excitement in the scientific community about its implications for longevity.

stories.title: Neighbors helping neighbors: Friendship Circle volunteers bring warmth in the cold
stories.summary: In the face of extreme cold, volunteers at Friendship Circle Café and Bakery came together to prepare warm meals for neighbors in need. Their collective effort not only provided nourishment but also strengthened community bonds, proving that kindness can shine even in the harshest conditions.

stories.title: Tiny falcons are helping keep the food supply safe on cherry farms
stories.summary: The American kestrel, a tiny falcon, is playing a crucial role in protecting cherry farms in northern Michigan. By hunting small pests, these raptors help maintain the health of the orchards, showcasing a beautiful example of nature's balance and the benefits of biodiversity in agriculture.

stories.title: Beloved mini horse missing as community rallies to help
stories.summary: The community has united to support the owner of Ricky, a beloved mini horse who has gone missing. Known for his gentle nature and educational visits, Ricky has touched many lives, and the outpouring of support highlights the deep connections formed between animals and their communities.

stories.title: FlashTags Could Revolutionize Livestock Protection In The West
stories.summary: A new technology involving illuminated livestock could revolutionize protection for ranchers in Montana. By using light to deter predators, this innovative approach aims to reduce livestock losses, blending creativity with practicality in the agricultural sector.

stories.title: Young cancer survivor from Alexandria celebrated New Year’s with surprise Caps tickets
stories.summary: Sutton Bullard, a young cancer survivor, celebrated the New Year with a surprise gift of Caps tickets, allowing her to watch her favorite team and meet her idol. This special moment marked a joyful milestone in her journey, reminding us of the power of hope and community support.

stories.title: Newborn puppies saved after being left in box
stories.summary: Thanks to the quick actions of the San Marcos Regional Animal Shelter, nine newborn puppies were rescued after being abandoned in a box. The shelter's dedicated team ensured the puppies received the care they needed, highlighting the importance of compassion in animal welfare.

stories.title: FDNY paramedics help deliver baby at Whitehall Ferry Terminal
stories.summary: Two FDNY paramedics made headlines after assisting in the delivery of a baby at the Whitehall Ferry Terminal. Their quick thinking and expertise not only brought new life into the world but also showcased the heroism and dedication of first responders in unexpected situations.

stories.title: New Redmond Drone Program Is Changing Emergency Response
stories.summary: Redmond, WA is pioneering a Drone as First Responder program that promises to enhance emergency response capabilities. This innovative approach aims to improve response times and safety, demonstrating how technology can transform community safety and emergency management.

stories.title: Omaha native rows solo across Atlantic in World’s Toughest Row
stories.summary: Omaha native Taryn Smith is taking on the challenge of a lifetime by rowing solo across the Atlantic Ocean in the World’s Toughest Row. After nearly three years of preparation, she's competing in this grueling 3,000-mile race, showcasing incredible determination and resilience as she navigates the vast ocean.

stories.title: Oral Surgeon Fixes Smiles, Transforms Lives in Bangladesh
stories.summary: Oral surgeon John Wallace and his team from Smile Bangladesh are changing lives one smile at a time. For over two decades, they've been repairing cleft lips and palates in Bangladesh, bringing hope and transformation to countless children who would otherwise go without essential care.

stories.title: Markey study finds targeted radiation therapy can be safely combined with chemotherapy
stories.summary: A groundbreaking study from the University of Kentucky's Markey Cancer Center reveals that targeted radiation therapy can be safely combined with high-dose chemotherapy. This advancement could significantly improve treatment outcomes for patients battling stage IV cancer, paving the way for more effective cancer care.

stories.title: Ridiculously Cute Coastal Martens are Secretive, OSU Scientists are Getting to Know Them
stories.summary: Oregon State University scientists are uncovering the secrets of the adorable coastal marten, a species nearly driven to extinction. Through a dedicated research project, they aim to better understand this elusive creature and contribute to its conservation, highlighting the importance of protecting our natural world.

stories.title: 200K bikes, 200K readers: CYCLE rewrites kids’ futures one bike at a time
stories.summary: CYCLE has reached a remarkable milestone by distributing its 200,000th bike to children who achieve their reading goals. This initiative not only promotes literacy but also empowers young learners in Title I schools, proving that education and joy can go hand in hand.

stories.title: The Man Who Showed That Faith and Reason Align
stories.summary: A thought-provoking exploration challenges the notion that faith and reason are incompatible. By highlighting the harmony between the two, it encourages a deeper understanding of how belief can coexist with logic, inspiring individuals to embrace both in their personal journeys.

stories.title: Utah man with rare facial condition sees his life story told on the big screen
stories.summary: Ben Kjar, a Utah man with a rare facial condition, is inspiring audiences nationwide with his documentary, 'STANDOUT: The Ben Kjar Story.' His journey of overcoming adversity and embracing his uniqueness is a powerful reminder of resilience and the beauty of personal stories.

stories.title: St.Landry Parish warming shelter offers hope amid freeze
stories.summary: As freezing temperatures hit St. Landry Parish, local leaders have opened a warming shelter to provide safety and comfort for those in need. With beds, hot meals, and a sense of community, this initiative ensures that no one is left out in the cold during these harsh conditions.

stories.title: Celebrating Evelyn Harris: Her voice filled the room again
stories.summary: At a heartfelt celebration of life for the late singer Evelyn Harris, her spirit filled the room as friends and fans gathered to honor her legacy. The event became a beautiful tribute, showcasing the power of music and community in keeping her memory alive.

stories.title: Mason City birthday party turns extra wild after guest wins $100K lottery prize
stories.summary: A birthday party in Mason City turned into an unforgettable celebration when Alyea Carter Greenan won a $100,000 lottery prize while scratching tickets with family. The joyous chaos that erupted in the room added an unexpected twist to the festivities, making it a birthday to remember!
